content: --मुख {%<ab>a.</ab>%} goat-faced. (--खः <ab>N.</ab> of a Prajāpati (Dakṣa.) When Dakṣa reviled Śiva at his sacrificial session, Vīrabhadra pulled out his face, and afterwards at the request of Śiva himself he put up a goat's face in place of the original human one. (--खी <ab>N.</ab> of a Rākṣasī kept to watch over Sītā in the Aśoka garden at Laṅkā.
